fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Free diving feat marks film A world record for free diving was broken this weekend off the Greek island Spetses to mark the release of The Freediver, starring British actress Camilla Rutherford and James Fox, writes Vanessa Thorpe. On the eve of the film's premiere, Martin Stepanek, 27, from the Czech Republic, dived unaided to a depth of 103 metres. The film will be released here next year. 28 hurt in nursery attack A man armed with a knife and explosives broke into a nursery in eastern China and slashed 28 children before police apprehended him yesterday. Swedes remember Lindh Hundreds of Swedes marked the first anniversary of the murder of Anna Lindh yesterday. People laid flowers outside the Stockholm department store where the politician was stabbed by a mentally ill man as she shopped. Greek church leader missing A Chinook helicopter taking Patriarch Petros, a leader of the Greek Orthodox church, to the monastic community on Mount Athos was reported missing yesterday. The patriarch was one of 12 passengers and four crew on board. Iran bus crash A bus carrying pilgrims across northern Iran crashed yesterday, killing 23 people and wounding 14 after the driver fell asleep at the wheel. The bus was heading towards the holy city of Mashhad.
